Open topic with navigation

Fault Memory Window

Start Page

Ribbon: Diagnostics & XCP Tab|Fault Memory

The fault memory list of an ECU can be read directly with the Fault Memory Window. You can also delete individual entries in the fault memory list (DTC - Diagnostic Trouble Code).

To read out the fault memory list of an ECU, the respective database must be loaded in a diagnostic description format (CDD, ODX or MDX).

After loading the diagnostic descriptions a Fault Memory Window is automatically opened, if the diagnostic description (CDD/ODX) has been assigned to a bus or a bus node ([Configure…] button). When a diagnostic description is configured as functional group requests, a specific Fault Memory Window is opened that allows you to send functional requests to all ECUs and to display the collection of all answers.

After opening the Fault Memory Window the fault memory list of the ECU can be read out via the button.

Note

Depending on the used diagnostic description CANoe might not be able to identify which services/messages shall be used for accessing the Fault Memory. In this case you may need to define these messages manually:

  • Click the Properties button .
  • In the Properties dialog open the Messages page.
  • Add new User-defined messages.
  • Confirm the Properties dialog with OK.
  • Select them using the Select Display Mode list .

Note that this option is only available if supported by the diagnostic description.

To sort the display of the error codes, you only need to click on that column header to display the lines in descending order. Clicking again on the same column header sorts the lines in ascending order.

With the respective icons in the toolbar the following commands are available when the window is activated:

Symbol

Command

Description

Tester Present

Tester Present requests are sent periodically to the ECU. Tester Present is a cyclically sent message to maintain communication with the ECU. With this button you can start or stop the sending of this messages. The status is also valid for the Diagnostic Console Window.

In the right corner of the symbol tray near the Online/Offline indicator is a LED situated that shows the Tester Present behavior: 

  • Gray: no TesterPresent send
  • Yellow: send TesterPresent
  • Green: received diagnostic response
  • Red: transmit error/timeout

Note

Tester Present requests can only be sent when the ECU is in the online state.

Cyclic Update

When this option is activated, the fault memory list is read out at regular time intervals.

Note

The option can be configured in the Properties dialog.

The cyclic time cannot be set precise in this dialog because it depends on the traffic between ECU and CANoe.
The range is between 1 and 10 seconds.

Update Fault Memory List

The fault memory list is reread

Delete DTC

Deletes the selected DTC

Delete All Diagnostic Trouble Codes

Deletes all displayed DTCs

Activate/Deactivate DTC logging

When this option is activated, the content of the Trace Window is written into the logging file.

Note

The name and directory of the logging files are configured in the Properties dialog.

DTC Filter

Activates/deactivates the defined DTC filters.

DTC Details

When this option is activated the environmental data of the selected DTC is displayed

Note

This option is only available if the CANdela database supports the option.

Select Display Mode
(only available via toolbar)

Opens a selection list with different display modes. As default the following modes are available:

  • Identified: The error codes currently active in the ECU are displayed. They can be deleted in the ECU via the commands or .
  • Supported: All error codes implemented in the ECU are displayed. This display cannot be deleted and the option Cyclic update has no effect.

Note

CANoe permits the adding of user-defined Messages to access the ECU Fault Memory. If you have defined these messages in the Properties dialog on the Messages page, they are displayed in the Select Display Mode list.

Properties

Opens the Properties dialog

 

Format of the DTC

Meaning

Symbolic

The DTC status is displayed in symbolic form (text in clear).

Raw values

The DTC status is displayed in hexadecimal form.

Binary

The DTC status is displayed in binary form.
